Articles.Content:
Update 1.8.9 for KSP 1.10.1 is up - [SpaceDock](https://spacedock.info/mod/473/Mk2%20Stockalike%20Expansion) | [GitHub](https://github.com/SuicidalInsanity/Mk2Expansion/releases/tag/1.8.9)  

ChangeLog:

Spoiler

-KSP 1.10.1 Update  

-New Part: Slanted Mk2-1.25 Adapter  

-Fixes decoupler crossfeed issue  

-Fixes <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> Blister offset issue  

-Banshee Fan doors have better clearance when open  

-Part Rework: All Chines have been conglomerated into three configurable omni parts  

-Old Chine parts moved to Legacy status  

-New Part: Configurable Chine <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> - multivariant <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> similar to the <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr>/OMS/ACS blisters  

-RC/PG <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> Chine parts moved to Legacy status  

-Part Rework: RCSAS

I remember not too long ago expressing a "hot dang" for the update back in July. Well, this is even better! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

I am getting a rather cryptic error when updating to the new MK2 expansion. Cryptic because I cannot find the part name that it claims is missing in the older version of the Mod or anywhere outside of my savefile.

When updating, one of my craft says it's missing part named "M2X.SCRCS"

The part has the following modules:

ModuleReactionWheel

ModuleRCSFX

TweakScale

Here are some additional properties:

  mass = 0.200000003  

  temp = 222.44842197290191  

  tempExt = 222.11755089271091  

  tempExtUnexp = 4

Based on that, I think the part name is actually the SC-01 <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> Stability Control Module. But I don't know why searching through the part files, it doesn't come up based on what it's called in the save file. Was this part modified/removed in the new update?

> 
> 
> 12 hours ago, helliwolf said:
> 
> 
> I am getting a rather cryptic error when updating to the new MK2 expansion. Cryptic because I cannot find the part name that it claims is missing in the older version of the Mod or anywhere outside of my savefile.
>

>

>

> ModuleReactionWheel
>

> ModuleRCSFX
>

> TweakScale

>   mass = 0.200000003  
> 
>   temp = 222.44842197290191

> Based on that, I think the part name is actually the SC-01 <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> Stability Control Module. But I don't know why searching through the part files, it doesn't come up based on what it's called in the save file. Was this part modified/removed in the new update?
> 

I'm also receiving this error.

It seems that a part has been removed in the latest release, whether by accident or otherwise. It seems to be the MK2 Inline Reaction Wheel/<abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> Combo Part

[@SuicidalInsanity](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/143878-suicidalinsanity/) was this intentional?

> 
> 
> 20 hours ago, helliwolf said:
> 
> 
> When updating, one of my craft says it's missing part named "M2X.SCRCS"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Based on that, I think the part name is actually the SC-01 <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> Stability Control Module. But I don't know why searching through the part files, it doesn't come up based on what it's called in the save file. Was this part modified/removed in the new update?
> 

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, SilentGunner13 said:
> 
> 
> I'm also receiving this error.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> It seems that a part has been removed in the latest release, whether by accident or otherwise. It seems to be the MK2 Inline Reaction Wheel/<abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> Combo Part
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [@SuicidalInsanity](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/143878-suicidalinsanity/) was this intentional?
> 

No, it wasn't intentional (not even sure how it happened); a fixed version of the update was re-uploaded yesterday.

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, SuicidalInsanity said:
> 
> 
> No, it wasn't intentional (not even sure how it happened); a fixed version of the update was re-uploaded yesterday.
> 

Oh, I see. I didn't realize these consecutive updates. The V1.8.9.2  IS the version I am using that has the stated error. The part appears to be missing from the latest SpaceDock version.

just tested with V 1.8.9.2 which is the latest version as far as spacedock and <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> are concerned and the "M2X.SCRCS" part missing message persists.

please look into it and thank you for your efforts.
I just want to say, I absolutely LOVE this update, thank you so much!

[@SuicidalInsanity](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/143878-suicidalinsanity/)  

    [LOG 18:14:42.681] PartLoader: Compiling Part 'Mk2Expansion/Parts/Utility/RCS/StabilityControl/M2X_SCRCS'
    [ERR 18:14:42.683] PartCompiler: Cannot clone model 'Mk2Expansion/Parts/Utility/RCS/SCModule' as model does not exist
    
    [ERR 18:14:42.683] PartCompiler: Model was not compiled correctly
    
    [ERR 18:14:42.683] PartCompiler: Cannot compile model
    
    [ERR 18:14:42.683] PartCompiler: Cannot compile part

I think this may have something to do with it?  

Edit: attempting to take the SCModule.mu file from ver 1.8.8 in Mk2Expansion-1.8.8\GameData\Mk2Expansion\Parts\Utility\<abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> found on the github and putting it in the current version install DOES FIX the issue, so the file is just missing.  

I repeat, this IS A WORKING FIX for anyone wanting to get the mod working immediately.

**Edited <time datetime="2020-08-15T22:31:14Z" title="08/15/2020 10:31  PM" data-short="3 yr">August 15, 2020</time> by Marxon**
  
Fix found

Also, something really funny happened to the landing legs:

Spoiler

![f4edc68094.jpg](https://puu.sh/GikEo/f4edc68094.jpg)

Edit: the footpads also angle themselves 90 degrees of pitch axis to ground.  

The Banshee lift fans have some issues with the new model animations as well with z fighting, just a heads up:

Spoiler

![17e0e6e84d.jpg](https://puu.sh/GilJO/17e0e6e84d.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2020-08-16T00:24:44Z" title="08/16/2020 12:24  AM" data-short="3 yr">August 16, 2020</time> by Marxon**
  
more info x2

Okay, I see what happened. The RCSAS fix made it into 1.8.9.1, but not 1.8.9.2 ( ...!? ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif ":huh:")). I can get a 1.8.9.3 update with the fix, and the fixes for the Banshee doors and landing leg up tomorrow.

All right, M2X 1.9.8.3 is now up - [SpaceDock](https://spacedock.info/mod/473/Mk2%20Stockalike%20Expansion) | [GitHub](https://github.com/SuicidalInsanity/Mk2Expansion/releases/tag/1.8.9)

-Fixes the Banshee door issue  

-Fixes the RCSAS missing  

-Fixes the Landing Leg

Bug: The Mk2 Tricoupler (pic) consistently loses its middle attach node when saved and loaded later. After i detach it from whatever it was attached to i can no loged attach it.

[https://imgur.com/a/NW2exur](https://imgur.com/a/NW2exur)

Anyone else notice how the jettison staging option on the AASRBS doesn't work as it already has a stage related function for the engine?

Edit: Also any chance we can get more options for the parts with <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> to use alternative fuels and/or larger ACS blisters? My atmospheric cargo <abbr title="Vertical Take-Off and Landing">vtol</abbr> is having to use some odd layouts of these things to have enough control authority to lift landed asteroids:  

Spoiler

![94945a5284.jpg](https://puu.sh/Gvq8C/94945a5284.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2020-09-22T23:13:58Z" title="09/22/2020 11:13  PM" data-short="3 yr">September 22, 2020</time> by Marxon**
Will Restock break this mod?

> 
> 
> On 9/24/2020 at 11:36 PM, Exxon21 said:
> 
> 
> Will Restock break this mod?
> 

The time for that has long passed. Any Restock problems are fixed by now.

I believe i've found a incompatibility with the TCA mod with a part from this mod (the SPL heavy duty landing leg). Whenever I place this on a craft, the TCA can no longer be triggered. If i remove this part, TCA becomes operational again.  

I've made a full report on the TCA forum, but maybe can you also look at it?

Bruh, you just exploded my brain! Thanks for showing me this, not only MK2 <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> but MK2 Drill too!  

Thanks again bud!

Hey! Apologies if I've misunderstood and these parts actually don't belong to your mods, but I *think* they do. It's the Mk2 Service Bay and Mk3 Service Bay, where you can configure a tank type to have in the middle of it.

I was wondering if it would be possible to add another type of "tank": A CLS compatible crew tube?

In the screenshot below, the cockpit and two passenger sections are all separate living spaces with no way to transfer crew between them (naturally). It would be really cool the service bay could get a "crew tank" option, for connecting those living spaces, while still leaving room for stuff around it, like with the other tanks. 

What do you think?

![JrlfwoM.png](https://i.imgur.com/JrlfwoM.png)

[@Svish](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/178935-svish/) CLS compatible hollow parts would need to be made separate from these (with only one option: structural, to spare this mod's maker from basically remaking his parts. Making a part that has many variants is not an easy task). It is unknown if B9 Part Switch naturally agrees with CLS and can control when a part is passable. This is the easiest of 3 possible solutions to this problem.
[@SuicidalInsanity](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/143878-suicidalinsanity/)Mind if I pull request to adapt the mk3 and mk2 fission reactors to nearteas new systemheat mod?
[@toric5](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/58046-toric5/) I don't mind, go ahead.
